other_tests.findings: Gallbladder is diffusely edematous with a small amount of hyperintense T1-weighted signal suggesting tiny stones or sludge. No appreciable pancreatic edema or fluid collections. Mild focal narrowing at the origin of the left hepatic duct with distal dilatation to 9 mm. Mild narrowing at the origin of the right hepatic duct with no appreciable distal dilatation. The common bile duct is moderately narrowed at the ampulla.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Gallbladder was edematous similar to prior ultrasound findings.

other_tests.findings: Few areas of narrowing and dilatation of the intra- and extra-hepatic biliary tree. No evidence of choledocholithiasis. No MR evidence of pancreatitis. Edematous nondistended gallbladder with small amount of sludge/tiny stones.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Follow-up MRCP recommended to evaluate for resolution.
